page.title: 17CONSERVATION AND POLLUTION
page.content: Following the successful International Garden Festival in Liverpool the Local Authority is following a similar approach in developing an area of derelict land known as Caulms Wood.At the moment many young trees of various kinds have been planted, but it is intended to also have 5 theme gardens, wild flower gardens,evergreen and flowering tree displays,an adventure playground and a viewing point looking over Dewsbury. Other attempts within the area have been made to improve the environment but pollution is still a problem. Pollution can be caused by car fumes, factories, and often by animals fouling the pavement.There is also dangerous litter like glass, old refrigerators, plastic bags, tin cans and mattresses.The most common litter in Chickenley was cigarette ends and we found 7736 of them in one day.
